comments:
[DTP 1.0M2b]

I defined a connection to a Oracle 10 database using the Oracle 10.2.0.1 thin driver. When I successfully connect it, I see the following exception in the Error Log:

Error
Mon Oct 09 18:48:24 CEST 2006
Editor core plugin internal error

java.sql.SQLException: Can not determine the correct server type by the conection profile: ORAS10
at org.eclipse.datatools.sqltools.internal.core.ControlConnectionManager.getOrCreateControlConnection(ControlConnectionManager.java:98)
at org.eclipse.datatools.sqltools.core.profile.SQLToolsProfileProxyListener.opened(SQLToolsProfileProxyListener.java:202)
at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.internal.ManagedConnection.setConnection(ManagedConnection.java:122)
at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.internal.ConnectionProfile$ConnectJob.run(ConnectionProfile.java:652)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I can see the database schema in the "Data Source Explorer", though, so it looks like the connection does work.

Now when I "Set Connection Info" in a SQL Editor using that connection and try to "Execute all" on some SQL, all I get is "Getrennte Verbindung" ("Connection closed" maybe in English) in the SQL Results view. Maybe that's related to the exception, maybe not, I don't know. All I know is that I cannot execute any SQL from the SQL editor...

Hi J?rg, the error log you saw is caused by the fact that SQL Dev Tools forced you to provide a customized IControlConnection. Now I've refactored the code so that it's no longer needed. But the error won't prevent you from connecting to the server, just as you observed. Since you opened the bug, there're some updates in SQL Dev Tools, so can you please have a try using the latest nightly build to see whether you can execute the sql statements?

traces.message: Can not determine the correct server type by the conection profile: ORAS10
